intro: Gnidia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar ironwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its slow growth and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant.
